content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

```julia
show(io::IO, fu::FloatWithUnits) = print("$(fu.value) $(fu.unit)")
```

The `print` function will write the output to the provided stream (`io`). The value of the variable that holds this struct is `fu`.

Note: if you want to add spaces when writing the result, put a space in the string and make sure it is escaped properly, e.g., `"1.8\t$(fu.unit)"` will print with a tab separating the value and unit.
